Description:
This file contains the structure and function prototypes for the MobileTV Device-side communications API.


Platform:
Platform Independent

  • 1.0 1st Release




Typedef Documentation

typedef D2H_eCBResult( * D2H_pfnEventCallback)(D2H_eAsyncEvent eEvent, img_uint8 *pui8Buff, img_uint32 ui32BuffNumBytes)

D2H_pfnEventCallback

Description:
This is the prototype for the asynchronous callback function.

eEvent : Indicates the event which has occurred.

pui8Buff : Pointer to message/data buffer.

ui32BuffNumBytes : Number of valid bytes in the message/data buffer.

D2H_eCBResult : This function returns either D2H_CB_SUCCESS or an D2H_eCBResult error code.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum D2H_eResult

This type defines the D2H function return codes.

Enumerator:
D2H_SUCCESS  Success.
D2H_ILLEGAL_PARAM  Function call has illegal param(s).
D2H_CB_ALREADY_DEFINED  Callback function already defined.
D2H_CB_NOT_DEFINED  Callback function not defined.

enum D2H_eCBResult

This type defines the D2H callback function return codes.

Enumerator:
D2H_CB_SUCCESS  Success.
D2H_CB_ERROR1  TBD, etc.

enum D2H_eAsyncEvent

This type defines the D2H callback function event codes.

Enumerator:
D2H_AE_CMD  Info/event/message.
D2H_AE_ERROR  Error has occurred.

enum D2H_eBuffType

This type defines the D2H buffer type.

Enumerator:
D2H_BT_MSG  Info/event/message.
D2H_BT_DATA  Data.

Function Documentation

IMG_VOID D2H_Initialise ( IMG_INT  i32Priority,
IMG_UINT32  ui32DmaChannel 
)

D2H_Initialise

Description:
This function initialises the device-to-host communications sub-system.

i32Priority : The priority which the COMMS task runs at.

ui32DmaChannel : The SDIOS DMA channel to use.

None.

IMG_VOID D2H_Deinitialise ( IMG_VOID   ) 

D2H_Deinitialise

Description:
This function de-initialises the device-to-host communications sub-system.

NOTE: Only used for test purposes.

None.

None.

D2H_eResult D2H_ReadCmdBlocking ( IMG_UINT8 *  pui8CmdBuff,
IMG_UINT32  ui32CmdBuffMaxBytes,
IMG_UINT32 *  pui32CmdNumBytes 
)

D2H_ReadCmdBlocking

Description:
This function reads a command from the host. This function is blocking and will not return until a command is received.

pui8CmdBuff : The pointer to the buffer to store the command.

ui32CmdBuffMaxBytes : The maximum size of the command buffer.

pui32CmdNumBytes : The actual number of command bytes received (may be greater than ui32CmdBuffMaxBytes, but in this case the extra bytes will not have been saved in the buffer and an error code - H2D_CMD_BUFF_OVERFLOW - will be returned).

D2H_eResult : Either D2H_SUCCESS or an D2H_eResult error code

D2H_eResult D2H_ReadCmdNonBlocking ( IMG_UINT8 *  pui8CmdBuff,
IMG_UINT32  ui32CmdBuffMaxBytes 
)

D2H_ReadCmdNonBlocking

Description:
This function reads a command from the host. This function is non-blocking and will return immediately. A callback will be made when the requested command has been received (or an error occurs).

pui8CmdBuff : The pointer to the buffer to store the command.

ui32CmdBuffMaxBytes : The maximum size of the command buffer.

D2H_eResult : Either D2H_SUCCESS or an D2H_eResult error code

D2H_eResult D2H_SendRsp ( IMG_UINT8 *  pui8RspBuff,
IMG_UINT32  ui32RspNumBytes 
)

D2H_SendRsp

Description:
This function sends a response from the device to the host.

pui8RspBuff : The pointer to the response buffer.

pui32RspNumBytes : The number of response bytes to send.

D2H_eResult : Either D2H_SUCCESS or an D2H_eResult error code

D2H_eResult D2H_SendAsyncBuff ( const D2H_sAsyncBufferDesc *  psBufferDescriptor  ) 

D2H_SendAsyncBuff

Description:
This function sends a group of one of more buffers to the host.

psBufferDescriptor : A structure describing the group of buffers to send. See the description of D2H_sAsyncBufferDesc

D2H_eResult : Either D2H_SUCCESS or an D2H_eResult error code

D2H_eResult D2H_AddCallback ( D2H_pfnEventCallback  pfnEventCallback  ) 

D2H_AddCallback

Description:
This function adds an asynchronous callback. The caller provides the address of a function that will be called when an asynchronous event occurs. The callback is persistent and is not removed when the application callback function is invoked.

Only one callback function may be defined at any given time. The callback function is removed using D2H_RemoveCallback().

pfnEventCallback : A pointer to the application callback function

D2H_eResult : Either D2H_SUCCESS or an D2H_eResult error code

D2H_eResult D2H_RemoveCallback ( IMG_VOID   ) 

D2H_RemoveCallback

Description:
This function removes the defined event callback. If the callback is already in progress when this function is called then it will complete normally; otherwise, the callback will be cancelled and no user callback will be made.

D2H_eResult : Either D2H_SUCCESS or an D2H_eResult error code
